roleset.name: try to sell, offer for sale, promote a product

example.name: basic transitive
example.text: The Food and Drug Administration allowed the company to begin marketing a new lens for use in cataract patients .

propbank.arg: a new lens for use in cataract patients

example.name: with prospective buyer
example.text: The facility will be marketed toward families , and room rates will be between $ 35 and $ 55 a night , MGM Grand said .

example.name: with attribute
example.text: Last week , Ford encountered a setback in its effort to broaden its U.S. luxury offerings when it was forced to abandon a four - year - old effort to market its German - built Scorpio sedan in the U.S. as a luxury import under the Merkur brand name .

propbank.arg: as a luxury import under the Merkur brand name

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: The company develops and markets products for the food service industry .

example.name: Arg 0 and 1
example.text: Its marketing of Southern Comfort Liqueur

roleset.note: MARKET-V NOTES: Note that the Arg3 is not the same as it is in the other commerceverbs, being attributive not price. Be wary, also, of adjectivalusages: "marketing executives" etc. (from market.01-v)
MARKETING-N NOTES: Added due to expansion of Nombank. No VN or FN classes. Comparison with market.01. Framed by Katie. (from marketing.01-n)
